alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 07 at 5:33PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: .A band of heavy rain is moving across far northeastern Aroostook County in the vicinity of Van Buren. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Overflowing of poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is possible in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Frenchville, New Canada, Madawaska Lake, Cross Lake, Lille, New Sweden, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Perham, Stockholm, Winterville, Westmanland, Guerette, Sinclair, Saint Agatha and Cyr Plantation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
